Package alix.lucene.util

Class Cooc

  • java.lang.Object
    • alix.lucene.util.Cooc
  • public class Cooc
extends java.lang.Object
    A co-occurrences scanner in a TextField of a lucene index. This field should store term vectors with positions FieldType.setStoreTermVectorPositions(boolean). Efficiency is based on a post-indexing of each document, affecting an int id to each term at its position (a “rail”). Also, coocs should be written on a “dead index”, with all writing operations committed.

    • Method Detail

      • write

        public void write()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Reindex all documents of the text field as an int vector storing terms at their positions BinaryDocValuesField. Byte ordering is the java default.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • rail

        public void rail​(org.apache.lucene.index.Terms termVector,
                 BinaryInts buf)
          throws java.io.IOException
        Flatten terms of a document in a position order, according to the dictionary of terms. Write it in a binary buffer, ready to to be stored in a BinaryField. BinaryDocValuesField The buffer could be modified if resizing was needed.
        Parameters:
        termVector - A term vector of a document with positions.
        buf - A reusable binary buffer to index.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • topTerms

        public TopTerms topTerms​(TermList terms,
                         int left,
                         int right,
                         org.apache.lucene.util.BitSet filter)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Get cooccurrences fron a multi term query. Each document should be available as an int vector see rail(Terms, BinaryInts). A loop will cross all docs, and
        Parameters:
        terms - List of terms to search accross docs to get positions.
        left - Number of tokens to catch at the left of the pivot.
        right - Number of tokens to catch at the right of the pivot.
        filter - Optional filter to limit the corpus of documents.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
